qas.question: What state's law says that death sentences must take place in an "enclosure"?
What law has similar language to Missouri Revised Statute § 546.730?
What state's law mandated that executions occur in ""room or place enclosed from public view"?
Along with United States Code Title 18 § 3596, what federal law limits the people who can witness a federal execution?
What state's law requires that capital punishment occur "within the walls" of a penitentiary?
What state's law says that death sentences must not take place in an "enclosure"?
What law has different language to Missouri Revised Statute § 546.730?
What state's law mandated that executions occur in ""room or place enclosed from private view"?
Along with United States Code Title 18 § 3596, what federal law limits the people who won't witness a federal execution?

context: Present-day statutes from across the nation use the same words and phrases, requiring modern executions to take place within a wall or enclosure to exclude public view. <a0_0><b5_0>Connecticut<b5_0/><a0_0/> General Statute § 54–100 requires death sentences to be conducted in an "enclosure" which "shall be so constructed as to exclude public view." <a1_0><b6_0>Kentucky Revised Statute 431.220<b6_0/><a1_0/> and Missouri Revised Statute § 546.730 contain substantially identical language. <a2_0><b7_0>New Mexico's<b7_0/><a2_0/> former death penalty, since repealed, see N.M. Stat. § 31-14-12, required executions be conducted in a "room or place enclosed from public view." Similarly, a dormant Massachusetts law, see Mass. Gen. Law ch. 279 § 60, required executions to take place "within an enclosure or building." <a4_0>North Carolina<a4_0/> General Statute § 15-188 requires death sentences to be executed "within the walls" of the penitentiary, as do Oklahoma Statute Title 22 § 1015 and Montana Code § 46-19-103. Ohio Revised Code § 2949.22 requires that "[t]he enclosure shall exclude public view." Similarly, Tennessee Code § 40-23-116 requires "an enclosure" for "strict seclusion and privacy." United States Code Title 18 § 3596 and the <a3_0><b8_0>Code of Federal Regulations 28 CFR 26.4<b8_0/><a3_0/> limit the witnesses permitted at federal executions.
